title: How is quantum spin measured of fermions and bosons? - Quora

response.answer_text: The spin of a particle is typically deduced from it’s magnetism. We fire a stream of particles through a magnet, and they are deflected according to their magnetic moment. The spin angular-momentum is determined by dividing out the magnetic part. It is also possible to check this by firing spin-polarized particles at a non-rotating target, and time how long it takes to rotate at some speed.
